If these familiars get within 10ft of a gargantuan sized creature before being noticed by it, they can scare it.
- One rat doing so frightens the creature for one round.
- Two rats doing so stuns the creature for one round.
- Three rats doing so paralyses the creature for one round.
These effects bypass any condition immunities the creature might have.
Once a creature has been affected this way, it becomes immune to being frightened, stunned or paralysed this way again for 24 hours.

Note: Each activation of this item summons one familiar; to recharge it please notify the DM (haven't implemented a way to let you do that yourself yet).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Breath of the Dragon
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You can channel destructive waves of energy, like those created by the dragons you emulate. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of the attacks with an exhalation of draconic energy in a 20-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Ki save DC, taking damage of the chosen type equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The damage of this feature increases to three and four rolls of your Martial Arts die at 11th and 17th level respectively.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Alternatively you can spend 2 Ki points to use this feature.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Legendary Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The way the potion shimmers is not unlike looking through a kaleidoscope.

When you drink this potion, you gain one Legendary Resistance for 8 hours. Spending it allows you to nullify the effect a single attack, spell, or ability would have on you.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Slumbering Dragon Vessel
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This vessel can be a potion bottle, drinking horn, or other container meant to hold a liquid.

As a bonus action, if the vessel is empty, you can speak the command word to fill the vessel with one of the following (your choice): ale, olive oil, a potion of healing, or a potion of climbing. Once this property is used, it can't be used until you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: +3 Dragonhide Belt
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
(requires attunement by a monk)

This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an action to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Water Breathing
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Continual Flame Gem
Shalkoc Zornax.description: The gem gives the look of a torch that burns providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Purity of Body
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Your mastery of the Ki flowing through you makes you immune to disease and allows you to use your Deflect Missiles feature on ranged spell attacks as well as ranged weapon attacks.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Fine Clothes
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Formal outfits for the entire party, except Plex which is too big in size.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Circlet of Wisdom
Shalkoc Zornax.description: This circlet grants a +2 bonus to the wearer’s Wisdom score when attuned.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Shifting Stances
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
For centuries, great warriors have looked to nature to find inspiration in battle. Countless monastic orders have crafted intricate unarmed fighting styles based on the deadliness and grace of natural creatures.

You can spend 1 Ki to enter a stance or shift from one to another, imitating the movements of the creature that inspired the stance's style. This stance lasts until you choose to end it, until you enter a different stance, or until combat ends.

You can enter a stance, change to a different stance, or end a stance only once per turn as a free action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mantis Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Based on the hunting techniques of the praying mantis, practitioners of this style fight with their hands turned down to emulate the insect’s sharp grasping forelimbs. Mantis style uses precise, accurate strikes to pinpoint an opponent’s vital areas, such as eyes, throat, and pressure points.

Embodying the style of the mantis, lets you add your proficiency bonus to your regular Ki save DC when you use Stunning Strike but the style also reduces your AC by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Tiger Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This style seeks to emulate the power and fury of the great tiger. Practitioners use their hands like claws, perfecting overpowering double hand strikes and driving attack chains.

The tiger style adds an amount of damage equal to your proficiency bonus to all natural weapon attacks you make but reduces your Ki save DC by the same amount.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Turtle Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Channeling the turtle’s legendary defense, practitioners of this style adopt a low, stable posture. Mobility is reduced, but they become a bastion of defense, capable of withstanding powerful strikes with calm composure.

The turtle style grants you a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus but the maximum distance you can move during each of your turns is limited to a number of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Drunken Brawler's Dancing Shoes
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can spend 1 Ki to cause that attack to hit one creature of your choice that you can see within 5ft.

If the attack missed you by 5 or more, you regain 1 Ki.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Handwraps of Swift Strikes
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you use Flurry of Blows and both attacks hit, you can immediately make one additional unarmed strike as a free action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian Scale of Transmutation
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.uA25JwLN2HLmf0zY]{Guardian of Nature} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.TGZYfNKcSo9lL4Hm]{Thorn Whip}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian Scale of Divination
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.9zmCEIQR2p0sXMZY]{Arcane Eye} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.4AvVLilynC0hoSMD]{Revelation Through Battle}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mythic Power
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The path of the Dragon is reserved for those of draconic bloodline, heirs to the divine legacy of Tiamat and Bahamut. This journey represents a rite of passage, unlocking the raw power and profound wisdom inherent in their heritage. From the awakening of their ancestral essence to a final, awe-inspiring transformation into a dragon, the path embodies the might and majesty of the ancient legends.

Mythic characters can draw upon a wellspring of power to accomplish amazing deeds and cheat fate. This power is used by a number of different abilities.

Each week, you can expend an amount of mythic power equal to 2 + twice your mythic rank.

This amount is your maximum amount of mythic power. If an ability allows you to regain uses of your mythic power, you can never have more than this amount.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Legendary Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can expend 1 Mythic Power as a free action to immediately gain and use &Reference[legres].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Rejuvenation
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Upon your death, if your life essence is not captured, it returns to your hoard, where it coalesces into an egg. Any items you were wearing or carrying at the time of death are also recalled to your hoard. After [[/r 1d10]] days, the egg hatches, and you are reborn as a tiny pseudodragon, retaining all memories from your previous lives.

After an additional [[/r 1d20]] days, your pseudodragon form grows to small size. Another [[/r 1d20]] days later, you are fully restored and can transform back into your dragonborn form, regaining all features and abilities you possessed before your death.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Tiamat's Tear
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Only a dragonborn of royal blood can use this unique gemstone to command the movements of the flying island Nabu-Anshar.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ki
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points, the maximum number of which is equal to your monk level.

You can spend these points to fuel various ki features.

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

Some of your ki features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Ki save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Aspect of the Wyrm
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The power of your draconic spirit now radiates from you, warding your allies.

As a bonus action, you create an aura around you that lasts for 1 minute and gives you and your allies within 20 feet of you resistance against all chromatic damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison.

Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend 4 Ki points to use it again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Wyrmreaver Gauntlets
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Requires attunement by a monk

Originally crafted for ground-bound giant brawlers to fight against dragons and other enormous predators of the sky, these studded gauntlets are engraved with the dragon rune.

While you are wearing these gauntlets, your unarmed strike deals an additional 1d6 force damage on a hit.

Guarding Runes

You have resistance to one of the following damage types of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You can change the chosen type when you finish a long rest.

Invoking the Runes

As a bonus action, you can invoke the gauntlets' runes and summon two enormous spectral fists that envelop the gauntlets and mimic your hand motions. The fists can also launch themselves to strike distant opponents, returning immediately to your space after they hit or miss.

The fists last for 1 minute or until you are Incapacitated. While the spectral fists are active, unarmed strikes you make on your turn have a reach of 30 feet, and when you hit a creature with an opportunity attack made with your unarmed strike, the creature must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or fall Prone.

Once the runes have been invoked, they can't be invoked again until the next dawn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ring of Free Action
Shalkoc Zornax.description: While you wear this ring, &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} doesn't cost you extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce your speed nor cause you to be &Reference[condition=paralyzed] or &Reference[condition=restrained].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Greater Invisibility - 4th
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
4th Level

You or a creature you touch becomes &Reference[condition=invisible] until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[condition=invisible] as long as it is on the target's person.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Cold Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Cold type damage for 1 hour.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dragon "Eyelashes"
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Actually are Eyelids.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Snack Pack
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Wondrous item

This bag can only hold food items, keeping them fresh indefinitely.

This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 3 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents spill forth unharmed. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Grilled Ribs
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Fall-off-the-bone ribs, coated in sweet and tangy homemade sauces, are a beloved favorite at most taverns, often served for events or celebrations, and eagerly enjoyed by adventurers returning triumphant from their quests or missions.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Thorn Whip
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes [[/damage 1d6 type=piercing]] damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.

This spell's damage increases by [[/r 1d6]] when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d6]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d6]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d6]]).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian of Nature
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A nature spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal Beast or Great Tree.

Primal Beast

Bestial fur covers your body, your facial features become feral, and you gain the following benefits:

  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You gain &Reference[rule=darkvision] with a range of 120 feet.
  • You make Strength-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra [[/damage 1d6 type=force]] damage on a hit.

Great Tree

Your skin appears barky, leaves sprout from your hair, and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain 10 temporary hit points.
  • You make Constitution saving throws with advantage.
  • You make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • While you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} for your enemies.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Draconic Amulet of Greed
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The damage you deal with your breath is increased by 1dx where x is your gp/1000.

Curse

This amulet is cursed and equipping it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the amulet, keeping it on your person at all times and refusing to take it off for more than a few minutes.

While cursed, you will become increasingly greedy and megalomaniacal, refusing to heed the advice of others, lashing out at the slightest perceived insult, and hording your valuables and refusing to spend any unless absolutely necessary.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dried Meat
Shalkoc Zornax.description: The process of drying meat is long and extensive. In some particular cases, for the highest quality of dried meat, it can take over a year. It is highly sought after due to its extended shelf life, and depending on the meat used, it is, quite frankly, delicious.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

  • Ability Score Increase. Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20. (WIS)

  • Draconic Healing. You can cast the Cure Wounds spell at 2nd level without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. The spell's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

  • Protective Wings. You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus ([[lookup @prof]]) against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ioun Stone, Language Knowledge
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of [[/r 1d3]] feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (&Reference[skill=Acrobatics]) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

You are fluent in one additional language while this pulsating bit of red jeweled crystal orbits your head. The DM chooses the language bestowed by the stone.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chili Pepper
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Harvested usually in most warm climates, it is used mainly as a spice in cuisines to add some "warmth" to the dish.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Bread
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Bread is a staple food made from dough that has been baked. It comes in a variety of shapes, sizes, and flavors. It is often sold as a side in most taverns and inns for any of the main meals they serve.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chef
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Time spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off, increasing your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20, and granting you proficiency with cook's utensils if you didn't already have it.

If you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand, you can prepare up to 10 meals during one hour of dedicated work or as part of a short or long rest. Each meal requires one food and, optionally, one spice.

When preparing a meal, you can choose to enhance either its restorative or preventative properties, granting it one of the following benefits:

  • Restorative. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 * your proficiency bonus.

  • Preventative. The creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 2d4 * your proficiency bonus.

Meals retain these enhanced properties only while fresh, meaning they must be consumed within 30 minutes of preparation. A creature that consumes a fresh meal gains the selected benefit as well as the effect of any spice used to flavor the meal.

A creature can benefit from only one enhanced meal per rest period.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Growth
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The red in the potion's liquid continuously expands from a tiny bead to color the clear liquid around it and then contracts. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the "enlarge" effect of the enlarge/reduce spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required):

While enlarged, your size is increased by one category and your weight is multiplied by eight.
You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws and your attacks with weapons deal an additional 1d4 damage.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dried Meat
Shalkoc Zornax.description: The process of drying meat is long and extensive. In some particular cases, for the highest quality of dried meat, it can take over a year. It is highly sought after due to its extended shelf life, and depending on the meat used, it is, quite frankly, delicious.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Instinctive Greed
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You develop an innate urge to accumulate wealth and amass a hoard of treasure in a single location, jealously guarding it from friend and foe alike.

If the total value of coins (platinum, gold, electrum, silver, and copper) and loot in your hoard exceeds the total value of coins and loot you carry on your person, you gain the following benefits:

  • When you deal poison damage, you deal additional poison damage equal to your mythic rank. This bonus is doubled when you deal poison damage with your breath weapon.

  • Gain a bonus to [[/skill dec]], [[/skill itm]], [[/skill per]], [[/skill ins]], [[/skill prc]], and [[/skill ste]] checks equal to your mythic rank.

If the total value of your hoard exceeds the combined value of coins and loot carried by you and all other party members, all bonuses granted by this feat are doubled.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mystifying Miasma
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As an action, you can expend 1 Mythic Power to create a cloud of mind-altering fog in a 1-mile radius that lasts for 1 hour.

The fog lightly obscures the area, and creatures inside it are unaware of their minds and senses being distorted by the miasma unless they are either immune to &Reference[illusion] or &Reference[enchantment] magic, succeed on a [[/check inv dc=30]] or [[/check prc dc=30]] check, or possess &Reference[rule=truesight]. Even if a creature becomes aware of the miasma’s mind-altering properties, they still suffer its effects as long as they remain within the fog.

The miasma distorts the mind and senses of other creatures while enhancing your ability to take advantage of their altered state of mind. While inside the area:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed] or &Reference[frightened] as well as on [[/skill ste]], [[/skill prc]], [[/skill ins]], and [[/skill dec]] checks.

  • Other creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed] or &Reference[frightened] as well as on [[/skill prc]], [[/skill ins]], and [[/skill sur]] checks.

Additionally, when you see a creature within the miasma make an attack, you can use your reaction to manipulate their perception, causing them to mistake another creature of your choice for their intended target, provided the new target is a valid option for the attack (e.g., within range). If the attacker is aware of the miasma's mind altering properties, they can make a [[/save wis format=long]] against your ki save DC to avoid the redirection of that attack.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Jump
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Grapple
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Boots of Blinding Speed
Shalkoc Zornax.description: While worn, your walking speed is increased by 30ft and you are &Reference[blinded].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dodge
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Stunning Strike
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be &Reference[condition=stunned] until the end of your next turn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Torpor
Shalkoc Zornax.description: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned] for 4d6 hours. The &Reference[poisoned] creature is &Reference[incapacitated].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Bracers of Asmodeus
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
If you do not wear armor or use a shield while wearing these bracers, you have a +2 bonus to AC and your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.

Additionally, you activate the bracers to cast the Command spell (save DC 18) at 1st level. A Counterspell attempting to interrupt a Command spell cast this way, treats this spell as if it was cast at 6th level. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until you finish a long rest.

Curse

While attuned to the bracers, you become obsessed with plotting, scheming, and manipulation. You always barter for better deals, often using secrets or leveraging other offers in the process. If you ever decline an opportunity to better yourself financially at another's expense, you immediately take [[/damage 3d10 type=necrotic]] damage. Only the Remove Curse spell allows you to end attunement to this item.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Command
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach.

The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop.

The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee.

The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel.

The target falls &Reference[condition=prone] and then ends its turn.

Halt.

The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Sending - 3rd
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a [[/r 1d20]]{5 percent} chance that the message doesn't arrive.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ginger
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Ginger, is widely used as a spice and folk medicine. It is provided as tea for those who have weak stomachs to combat nausea, among other things.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Leaden Fist
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Requires attunement by a monk

These heavy handwraps are adorned with large granite prayer beads, each engraved with writing in ancient Terran.

You can use your action and bonus action on your turn and expend 2 ki points to make a single, powerful unarmed strike that always deals bludgeoning damage. When calculating damage for this attack, instead of rolling a single Martial Arts die, roll a number of Martial Arts dice equal to your monk level.

If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you regain 1 ki point.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Shield - 1st
Shalkoc Zornax.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Borrowed Knowledge - 2nd
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You draw on knowledge from spirits of the past. Choose one skill in which you lack proficiency. For the spell's duration, you have proficiency in the chosen skill. The spell ends early if you cast it again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Speed
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the Haste spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). The potion's yellow fluid is streaked with black and swirls on its own.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Purple Worm Poison
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The name of this poison has been made up by alchemists to make it seem like it's more difficult to obtain than it really is.

A creature subjected to this poison must make a [[/save con 19 format=long]], taking [[/damage 12d6 poison]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Broth of Needful Fortitude
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Favored by intelligent undead, this rich stock is brewed from the flesh and bones of humanoids and typically kept sealed in an earthenware jar. When you consume this broth, you can reduce your &Reference[condition=exhaustion] level by up to 2, and you have advantage on Constitution saving throws against disease, poison, and environmental effects for 8 hours. If you are undead, you also regain [[/r 3d6]] hit points.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chili Pepper
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Harvested usually in most warm climates, it is used mainly as a spice in cuisines to add some "warmth" to the dish.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Hand of Healing
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to touch a willing creature and roll two Martial Arts die. The target creature regains a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your proficiency bonus plus your Wisdom modifier.

When you do so, you can also end one &Reference[disease]{disease} or one of the following conditions affecting the creature: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], &Reference[poisoned], or &Reference[stunned].

This replaces your Quickened Healing feature.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Greater Restoration - 9th
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Little Finger of Dam'ghur
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As an action, you can point the wand at any number of undead creatures of your choice within 30 feet., commanding them to return to death. Each targeted creature of Challenge Rating 1 or less must succed [[/save cha 15]] saving throw or be reduced to 0 hit points.

The wand has 10 charges. It regains [[/r 1d6]] expended charges when you finish a long rest. While holding the wand, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it: False Life (2 charges per spell level), Gentle Repose (2 charges), Speak with Dead (3 charges).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Speak with Dead
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: False Life
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain [[/r 1d4 + 4]] temporary hit points.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Gentle Repose
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead.

The spell also effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as raise dead.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Cure Wounds (2nd Level)
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to [[/r 2d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 1st.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Heroism
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This blue potion bubbles and steams as if boiling.

When you drink this potion you gain 10 temporary hit points. Additionally you are under the effect of the Bless spell for 1 hour (no concentration required).

effects.flavorText: An act of valor brings the city together, restoring faith in its protectors and fostering a newfound sense of camaraderie.
effects.name: Heroic Deed

buildings.flavorText: Within its halls of thought, scholars question the old ways and craft the new, the academy’s influence rippling through the city as it births both wisdom and unrest.
buildings.name: Academy

buildings.effectText: Enables travel and trade via airships.
buildings.flavorText: A bustling hub of towering scaffolds and massive mooring lines, the dockyard is where skyships are built, loaded, and launched. Merchants and smugglers alike strike deals beneath the towering hulls, while city officials struggle to keep control of what goes in and out.
grants: Enables travel and trade via airships.
buildings.name: Airship Dockyard

buildings.flavorText: Here, within halls lined with models and plans, architects refine construction methods, making ambitious projects achievable with less effort.
buildings.name: Architect’s Guild

buildings.flavorText: Inside the barracks, the clamor of armor and weapons is constant, a reassuring sound for some and a reminder of authority's ever-watchful presence for others.
buildings.name: Barracks

buildings.flavorText: Hidden behind unmarked doors and veiled glances, the black market thrives in defiance of law and morality, a realm where rare and illicit goods, services, and secrets are only a matter of coin.
buildings.name: Black Market

buildings.effectText: Enables the planting and farming of various herbs.
buildings.flavorText: Nestled in vibrant greenery, the botanical garden blends nature and science, its carefully tended plants offering rare resources to those who know how to harvest their potential.
grants: Enables the planting and farming of various herbs.
buildings.name: Botanical Garden

buildings.flavorText: Whispers of discontent fill the streets as the brothel flourishes, a gilded cage where the powerful indulge while the common folk see their dignity sold one night at a time.
buildings.name: Brothel

buildings.effectText: Activity: Apprenticeship (Gain proficiency with carpenter's tools after spending 2d4 extended rests on this activity.)
buildings.flavorText: From dawn to dusk, the hum of saws and the scent of fresh timber define the carpenter’s workshop, a place where craftsmanship turns rough wood into everything from simple furniture to the grand beams of the city’s halls
grants: Activity: Apprenticeship (Gain proficiency with carpenter's tools after spending 2d4 extended rests on this activity.)
buildings.name: Carpenter's Workshop

buildings.effectText: Grants the patron deity's blessing to the city as long as its edicts are followed.
buildings.flavorText: Towering over the city as a fortress of faith, the cathedral is both a place of worship and a symbol of divine protection. Few dare challenge a city under the watchful gaze of its patron deity.
grants: Grants the patron deity's blessing to the city as long as its edicts are followed.
buildings.name: Cathedral

buildings.flavorText: A city well-defended is a city that endures. The walls ensure safety, though merchants grumble at the restricted flow of goods.
buildings.name: City Walls

buildings.flavorText: A hive of hammering, shouting, and relentless movement, the construction yard turns raw resources into grand visions, though its clamor often drowns out the city's quieter joys.
buildings.name: Construction Yard

buildings.flavorText: Fair trials, strict rulings—this is where disputes are settled and criminals face judgment. It keeps the city in order, even if it stifles progress.
buildings.name: Courthouse

buildings.effectText: 8 bottles of the legendary Bugman’s Ale are available for purchase each month.
buildings.flavorText: The air around the Dwarven Brewery is always thick with the smell of brewing ale. It is a place where dwarven tradition meets celebration, its warm hearth a beacon on cold nights.
grants: 8 bottles of the legendary Bugman’s Ale are available for purchase each month.
buildings.name: Dwarven Brewery

buildings.flavorText: A noisy, chaotic space where problems are solved with gears, levers, and the occasional explosion. Some see it as the future—others see it as a disaster waiting to happen.
buildings.name: Engineer's Workshop

buildings.flavorText: Nestled amidst open fields, the farm is a lifeline for the town, producing fresh crops and bringing families together in shared labor and celebration of the land.
buildings.name: Farm

buildings.flavorText: The fighting pit draws crowds and coin alike, but some fear its focus on bloodsport dulls the town’s desire for anything more meaningful.
buildings.name: Fighting Pit

buildings.flavorText: Few things enforce authority like the sight of a hanging body. The gallows keep the city in line, though the weight of fear dampens ambition and sows unease among the people.
buildings.name: Gallows

buildings.effectText: Activity: Apprenticeship (Gain proficiency with glassblower's tools after spending 2d4 extended rests on this activity.)
buildings.flavorText: From humble drinking vessels to intricate lenses, the Glasshouse provides the city with objects of both utility and exquisite beauty.
grants: Activity: Apprenticeship (Gain proficiency with glassblower's tools after spending 2d4 extended rests on this activity.)
buildings.name: Glasshouse

buildings.effectText: Trader: Spices; The number of spices for sale each month scales with the settlement's Economy.
buildings.flavorText: Glim Billowdwaddle’s bustling emporium draws spice merchants and food enthusiasts alike, though its extravagance has stirred resentment among the common folk.
grants: Trader: Spices; The number of spices for sale each month scales with the settlement's Economy.
buildings.name: Glim's Emporium of Exotic Flavours

buildings.flavorText: Chaotic, noisy, and endlessly inventive, the goblin quarters overflow with peculiar contraptions and questionable experiments, their ingenuity both a marvel and a menace.
buildings.name: Goblin Quarters

buildings.flavorText: A towering symbol of plenty, the granary secures the fruits of the harvest, ensuring that even in scarcity, no family need go without.
buildings.name: Granary

buildings.flavorText: The graveyard stands as a solemn reminder of lives past, a quiet place of reflection that fosters unity among the living through shared grief and memory.
buildings.name: Graveyard

buildings.flavorText: A humble sanctuary for the destitute, where kindness outweighs profit, though not without resentment from those who see generosity as wasteful.
buildings.name: Homeless Shelter

buildings.flavorText: A haven for locals and travellers alike, the inn stands as a cornerstone of the community, a place where the weary find respite and the curious find intrigue.
buildings.name: Inn

buildings.flavorText: Behind its barred windows, the jail holds those who defy the law, its presence a quiet warning to any who might challenge the town’s authority.
buildings.name: Jail

buildings.flavorText: The library stands as a testament to the value of knowledge, where every book and tome represents a step toward a brighter, more enlightened future.
buildings.name: Library

buildings.flavorText: Vendors call out their wares, children weave through the crowds, and deals are struck with firm handshakes. The old ways of trade and barter hold strong in this lively square.
buildings.name: Market Square

buildings.flavorText: Within these walls, monks devote themselves to prayer and labor, their careful craftsmanship supporting both their faith and the city beyond.
buildings.name: Monastery

buildings.flavorText: A symbol of the town’s might and wealth, the monument inspires awe in some but frustration in others, who see it as an unnecessary display of vanity.
buildings.name: Monument

buildings.effectText: While bound, the Nullstone Monolith prevents teleportation magic in and out of a 10 mile radius sphere.
buildings.flavorText: Built around the Nullstone Monolith, the nexus sacrifices innovation and trade to create a sanctuary impervious to magical intrusion.
grants: While bound, the Nullstone Monolith prevents teleportation magic in and out of a 10 mile radius sphere.
buildings.name: Nexus of Binding

buildings.flavorText: A place of refuge for those without families, the orphanage provides care for the town’s lost children, though whispers from the guilds bemoan the loss of cheap labor.
buildings.name: Orphanage

buildings.flavorText: Amidst the city's bustle, the park offers a serene retreat where nature flourishes and minds find inspiration, though its upkeep demands a toll on the city's coffers.
buildings.name: Park

buildings.flavorText: Within its sturdy walls, the lodge fosters daring ventures and questionable alliances, attracting mercenaries, explorers, and the intrigue that inevitably follows in their wake.
buildings.name: Pathfinder Society Lodge

buildings.flavorText: A modest workshop of bubbling flasks and pungent fumes, the alchemist's laboratory is a sanctuary for discovery, where one mind's quiet pursuit of knowledge might yield wonders.
grants: Reduces the time to craft potions by 30 minutes.

buildings.flavorText: While the school strengthens the community and pushes for progress, it also teaches the value of questioning authority—something not all are eager to see.
buildings.name: School

buildings.flavorText: Beneath the town, the newly constructed sewer system flows—a marvel of engineering that improves health and cleanliness, though its hidden depths harbor unseen secrets.
buildings.name: Sewer System

buildings.flavorText: A small but meaningful landmark, the shrine serves as a gathering place for those who seek comfort in faith and tradition.
buildings.name: Shrine

buildings.flavorText: Billowing smoke and glowing embers mark the heart of the smithy, where metal meets fire to create everything from horseshoes to blades.
buildings.name: Smithy

buildings.flavorText: The stables provide not only shelter for horses but also serve as a hub for the town’s mounted forces, ensuring swift responses to any threats.
buildings.name: Stables

buildings.flavorText: A relic of old justice—crude, effective, and a stark reminder of the consequences of breaking the law.
buildings.name: Stocks
